intro: Senecio kryophilus, commonly known as the alpine groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Senecio kryophilus is adapted to harsh alpine conditions and is often found in mountainous areas with limited vegetation.
